title: 80 Ping But still Sliding ?
body: For some reason I am able to use Discord/youtube/ Anything you can think of but when I go to play league of legends I start sliding inside of my games.

replies.body: I had a ranked game where I was playing okay for the first 5 minutes, then all of a sudden my game froze and I would either teleport to places or slide around and it was if my ping went to the 2000s, but my ping stayed at a consistent 75 and my fps registered as normal. For the rest of the game, my character and other characters stayed still on the map. After I lost my ranked game, my game stopped loading and wouldn't even finish with the "defeat" screen. My internet connection is stable too and no one in my game was experiencing this issue except for me.
Yep. Just time to wait I suppose.
So I just called my ISP and they say they are having problems. DO NOT play league rn. they say it can take up to four hours.

Good to know.
I'm not on the bill/account for the internet, so I couldn't call.

Even if your net is working fine elsewhere, you can still have issues specifically reaching a service like the game server.  Your fluctuating ping could be due to an unstable network to the game server, so you'll want to run through the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to troubleshoot.  Let me know if you have any questions!

I had a similar issue earlier. Not as bad as sliding, but commands had a noticable delay more than usual.

My ping to google was 45-50 (I have a ping -t cmd prompt running constantly on my second monitor), and LoL ping was normal at around 75-ish. Was likely small packetloss from something. Often when I get these sorts of things, it's ISP related, and the problem passes after an hour or two.

Even though your net can connect to other services, you can still have trouble reaching specifics ones like the game server.  If your ping is fluctuating a lot, then I suggest using the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to make sure your settings and access to our game server is holding string.  Test it in a custom game to be sure!
It's probably because of the unexpected rain today.
